name: monometallism
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the use of a single metal, for example gold or silver, as the standard currency (= money used) in a particular country: The country returned to monometallism in 1873. Adopting gold monometallism was seen as a symbol of financial confidence.
More examplesFewer examplesIf the country adopted silver monometallism, would gold be cheaper than silver?The reforms included the introduction of gold monometallism in the country.A number of countries moved from silver monometallism to gold.
